diff_hunk:
@@ -2,9 +2,10 @@ graph(%z.1 : Dynamic
       %y : Dynamic) {
   %2 : int = prim::Constant[value=1]()
   %3 : Dynamic = aten::add(%z.1, %y, %2)
-  %4 : Dynamic = aten::gt(%3, %z.1)
-  %5 : int = prim::TensorToNum(%4)
-  %z : Dynamic = prim::If(%5)
+  %4 : int = prim::TensorToNum(%3)
+  %5 : int = prim::TensorToNum(%z.1)
+  %6 : int = aten::gt(%4, %5)
+  %z : Dynamic = prim::If(%6)
body: Why did this change? The test does `bool(x + y > x)`, but this is effectively compiled down to `bool(int(x + y) > int(x))`. Where do the extra integer casts come from?
body_html: Why did this change? The test does bool(x + y > x), but this is effectively compiled down to bool(int(x + y) > int(x)). Where do the extra integer casts come from?
body_text: Why did this change? The test does bool(x + y > x), but this is effectively compiled down to bool(int(x + y) > int(x)). Where do the extra integer casts come from?
